noun.description: A native or inhabitant of Philippi, an ancient city in Macedonia.

adjective.description: Of or relating to Philippi or its inhabitants.

origin: Early 16th century; earliest use found in The New Testament. From Philippi (classical Latin Philippī, ancient Greek Φιλίπποι) the name of a city in ancient Macedon (now in north-eastern Greece), named after Philip II, king of Macedon (reigned 359–36 b.c.) + -an.
